text: Elephant Island is an ice-covered, mountainous island off the coast of Antarctica. It is at the edge of the South Shetland Islands, in the Southern Ocean. It has an area of 558 kmÂ², and its highest elevation is 973 metres. == Name == Elephant Island's name refers to both its elephant head-like appearance and the sightings of elephant seals by Captain George Powell in 1821, one of the early sightings. Category:Uninhabited islands Category:Geography of Antarctica
title: Elephant Island
